intro: Hieracium aurorinii, commonly known as the aurora hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium aurorinii is often found in open habitats at high elevations, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
